intro: Paramapania amboinensis, commonly known as the Amboina paramapania, is a flowering plant native to Indonesia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, or white. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and often have a velvety texture. Paramapania amboinensis is primarily grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking floral display.
